bookTitle: St. Francis of Assisi: Passion, Poverty and the Man who Transformed the Catholic Church

questions.question: How did Francis' largesse take on religious meaning instead of his spendthrift ways on worldly goods?
acceptableAnswers: He began to give away food, money and clothes to the poor
He went on a pilgrimage to Rome
distractors: He invested his father's money in monastery renovations
He donated his inheritance to the monastery
He sold all his possessions and became a hermit
He started a charitable foundation for the poor
He funded the construction of new churches

questions.question: Name one way that Francis embraced the life of a lay-penitent.
distractors: Daily Mass attendance
Studying theology
Teaching catechism
Joining a monastery
Preaching in the streets

questions.question: Francis turned from sin and had a change of heart in his what?
distractors: Baptism
Confirmation
Pilgrimage
Prayer
Meditation

questions.question: What group of people did Francis begin to serve regularly?
distractors: The merchants
The knights
The monks
The beggars
The prisoners

questions.question: The lepers provided the most concrete way of what for Francis?
distractors: Practicing humility
Showing charity
Doing penance
Serving God
Embracing poverty

questions.question: Instead of spending time in universities or studying theology, what taught Francis everything?
distractors: The Bible and Scripture
The lives of the saints
Prayer and meditation
The teachings of priests
His experiences with the poor

questions.question: What did the overpowering love of God feel like to Francis as he gazed at the crucifix at San Damiano?
questions.correctAnswer: It was as if the Lord emerged from the crucifix and entered into Francis' heart
distractors: It felt like fire burning away his sins
It felt like light illuminating his mind
It felt like peace washing over his soul
It felt like strength filling his body
It felt like joy overflowing in his spirit

questions.question: What did Francis hear the voice tell him to do?
questions.correctAnswer: Francis, go and rebuild my house, which, as you can see, is totally in ruin
distractors: Francis, go and preach the gospel to all nations
Francis, go and serve the lepers with all your heart
Francis, go and renounce your father's wealth
Francis, go and gather followers to serve me
Francis, go and live a life of prayer and penance

questions.question: What was true about San Damiano that made Francis interpret the voice to mean to physically rebuild it?
questions.correctAnswer: It was in disrepair and needed to be rebuilt
distractors: It had been destroyed by an earthquake
It was scheduled to be demolished
It had been abandoned for years
It was falling down from age
It had been damaged in the war

questions.question: What impetuous thing did Francis do to start rebuilding San Damiano immediately?
questions.correctAnswer: He sold a bolt of fine cloth and a horse belonging to his father
distractors: He took money from his father's strongbox
He sold his armor and weapons
He begged for donations in the streets
He traded his fine clothes for building materials
He borrowed money from wealthy merchants

questions.question: Why did Francis question his decision to sell his father's property to help rebuild San Damiano?
questions.correctAnswer: Because Father Peter would not accept the money, he realized he had done something wrong
distractors: Because his father threatened to disinherit him
Because the townspeople mocked his foolishness
Because he didn't get enough money for the materials
Because his mother begged him to return the money
Because God told him in a vision he had acted wrongly
